For Friday, February 5

Posted by Brian Moseley

Tutorials Next Week (Feb. 8 and 9)

  1. You'll have to play I–V(7)–I progressions in any major or minor key, using each of these three melodic scale degree patterns: 3-2-1, 1-7-1, and 3-4-3.
  2. You'll have to sight-sing a melody that highlights the dominant triad. In addition to the practice you're doing in class, you can find additional exercises in the Karpinski anthology, Chapter 25.

We will have the first fundamentals quiz tomorrow, where I’ll ask you to write some progression involving dominant preparation chords moving to dominant chords. Use the assignment that was due Monday as practice.

  1. Chapter 9, p. 137, #5: a,b, and c.
  2. Chapter 9, p. 138, #6: a,b, and c.
  3. Chapter 9, p. 139, #7, a,b, and c.

Here’s a copy of the Chapter 9 workbook for those of you that don’t have a copy.

And here’s an answer keyto check your work against.
